children.name: Maximum depth of nesting
desc: The maximum depth of nesting of the control flow structure found in the function.

children.name: Number of files
desc: The number of code files (e.g. .java for Java) in code hierarchy. Often used to build indexes.

children.name: Comment rate
desc: The ratio of source lines of code on the the number of comment lines of code.

children.name: Number of attributes
desc: Total number of attributes defined in the class.

children.name: Number of methods
desc: Total number of methods defined in the class.

children.name: Number of public attributes
desc: Total number of public attributes defined in the class.

children.name: Number of public methods
desc: Total number of public methods defined in the class.

children.name: Depth of Inheritance Tree
desc: Maximum depth of inheritance tree in the artefact.

children.name: Function cloning
desc: The amount of duplicated lines in the code.

children.name: Cyclomatic Complexity
desc: The number of execution paths found in the function.

children.name: Number of distinct operands
desc: The number of distinct operands found in the function.

children.name: Number of distinct operators
desc: The number of distinct operators found in the function.

children.name: Total number of operands
desc: The total number of operands found in the function.

children.name: Total number of operators
desc: The total number of operators found in the function.

children.name: Number of non-conformities for changeability
desc: The number of violations to rules that impact changeability in the artefact.

children.name: Number of violated rules for changeability
desc: The number of changeability rules that have at least one violation on the artefact.

children.name: Number of rules for changeability
desc: The total number of rules checked for changeability.

children.name: Non conformities index for changeability
desc: The total number of violations to rules that impact changeability in the artefact, divided by the number of files.

children.name: Adherence to changeability rules
desc: Ratio of conform changeability practices on the number of checked changeability practices.

children.name: Number of non-conformities for analysability
desc: The number of violations to rules that impact analysability in the artefact.

children.name: Number of violated rules for analysability
desc: The number of analysability rules that have at least one violation on the artefact.

children.name: Number of rules for analysability
desc: The total number of rules checked for analysability.

children.name: Non conformities index for analysability
desc: The total number of violations to rules that impact analysability in the artefact, divided by the number of files.

children.name: Adherence to analysability rules
desc: Ratio of conform analysability practices on the number of checked analysability practices.

children.name: Number of non-conformities for reliability
desc: The number of violations to rules that impact reliability in the artefact.

children.name: Number of violated rules for reliability
desc: The number of reliability rules that have at least one violation on the artefact.

children.name: Number of rules for reliability
desc: The total number of rules checked for reliability.

children.name: Non conformities index for reliability
desc: The total number of violations to rules that impact reliability in the artefact, divided by the number of files.

children.name: Adherence to reliability rules
desc: Ratio of conform reliability practices on the number of checked reliability practices.

children.name: Number of non-conformities for reusability
desc: The number of violations to rules that impact reusability in the artefact.

children.name: Number of violated rules for reusability
desc: The number of reusability rules that have at least one violation on the artefact.

children.name: Number of rules for reusability
desc: The total number of rules checked for reusability.

children.name: Non conformities index for reusability
desc: The total number of violations to rules that impact reusability in the artefact, divided by the number of files.

children.name: Adherence to reusability rules
desc: Ratio of conform reusability practices on the number of checked reusability practices.

children.name: Percentage of lines of code covered by tests
desc: The percentage of source lines of code that is exercised by the tests.

children.name: Percentage of branches covered by tests
desc: The percentage of branches that is exercised by the tests.

On a given line of code, Line coverage simply answers the following question: Has this line of code been executed during the execution of the unit tests?. It is the density of covered lines by unit tests.

children.name: Number of tests relative to the code size
desc: The total number of test cases for the product, divided by the number of thousands of SLOC.
Metric is computed from SonarQube's metrics tests and ncloc ).

children.name: Test success density
desc: The percentage of failed tests during the last execution of the test plan.
Computation is as follows:
Test success density = (Unit tests - (Unit test errors + Unit test failures)) / Unit tests * 100
Unit test errors is the number of unit tests that have failed, Unit test failures is the number of unit tests that have failed with an unexpected exception.

children.name: Developer ML posts
desc: Total number of posts on the developer mailing list during the last month.

Number of messages dated during the last month, in developer mailing list archives. Developer mailing list is the list or lists considered as 'for developers' in the project documentation. The date used is the mailing list server date, as stamped in the message. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: Developer ML authors
desc: Number of distinct authors (according to their email address) on the developer mailing list during last month.

Number of distinct senders for messages dated during the last month, in developer mailing list archives. Developer mailing list is the list or lists considered as 'for developers' in the project documentation. The date used is the mailing list server date, as stamped in the message. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included). Distinct senders are those with distinct email addresses. Email addresses used are the strings found in 'From:' fields in messages.

children.name: Developer ML response time
desc: Median time of first reply to questions in the developer mailing list during last month.

Median period from first message in thread to second message in thread, for all threds with at least two messages dated during the last month, in developer mailing list archives. Threads are identified using 'In-Reply-To' message headers. Developer mailing list is the list or lists considered as 'for developers' in the project documentation. The date used is the mailing list server date, as stamped in the message. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included). Unit is days.

children.name: Developer ML response ratio
desc: Average number of responses for a question in the developer mailing list during last month.

Average number of messages in thread, minus one, for all threds of messages dated during the last month, in developer mailing list archives. Threads are identified using 'In-Reply-To' message headers. Developer mailing list is the list or lists considered as 'for developers' in the project documentation. The date used is the mailing list server date, as stamped in the message. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: Developer ML subjects
desc: Number of threads in the developer mailing list during last month

Number of threds of messages dated during the last month, in developer mailing list archives. Threads are identified using 'In-Reply-To' message headers. Developer mailing list is the list or lists considered as 'for developers' in the project documentation. The date used is the mailing list server date, as stamped in the message. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: User ML posts
desc: Total number of posts on the user mailing list during the last month.

Number of messages dated during the last month, in user mailing list archives. User mailing list is the list or lists considered as 'for users' in the project documentation. The date used is the mailing list server date, as stamped in the message. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: User ML authors
desc: Number of distinct authors (according to their email address) on the developer mailing list during last month.

Number of distinct senders for messages dated during the last month, in user mailing list archives. User mailing list is the list or lists considered as 'for users' in the project documentation. The date used is the mailing list server date, as stamped in the message. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included). Distinct senders are those with distinct email addresses. Email addresses used are the strings found in 'From:' fields in messages.

children.name: User ML response time
desc: Median time of first reply to questions in the user mailing list during last week.

Median period from first message in thread to second message in thread, for all threds with at least two messages dated during the last month, in user mailing list archives. Threads are identified using 'In-Reply-To' message headers. User mailing list is the list or lists considered as 'for users' in the project documentation. The date used is the mailing list server date, as stamped in the message. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included). Unit is days.

children.name: User ML response ratio
desc: Average number of responses for a question in the user mailing list during last month.

Average number of messages in thread, minus one, for all threds of messages dated during the last month, in user mailing list archives. Threads are identified using 'In-Reply-To' message headers. User mailing list is the list or lists considered as 'for users' in the project documentation. The date used is the mailing list server date, as stamped in the message. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: User ML subjects
desc: Number of threads in the user mailing list during last month

Number of threds of messages dated during the last month, in user mailing list archives. Threads are identified using 'In-Reply-To' message headers. User mailing list is the list or lists considered as 'for users' in the project documentation. The date used is the mailing list server date, as stamped in the message. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: SCM Commits
desc: Total number of commits registered on the artefact during the last month.

Total number of commits in source code management repositories dated during the last month. Source code management repositories are those considered as such in the project documentation. Commits in all branches are considered. Date used for each commit is 'author date' (when there is a difference between author date and committer date). Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: Files committed
desc: Total number of files found in all commits that happened during the last month.

Total number of files touched by commits in source code management repositories dated during the last month. Source code management repositories are those considered as such in the project documentation. Commits in all branches are considered. A file is 'touched' by a commit if its content or its path are modified by the commit. Date used for each commit is 'author date' (when there is a difference between author date and committer date). Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: SCM committers
desc: Total number of different author identities found in commits during last month.

Total number of identities found as authors of commits in source code management repositories dated during the last month. Source code management repositories are those considered as such in the project documentation. Commits in all branches are considered. Date used for each commit is 'author date' (when there is a difference between author date and committer date). An identity is considered as author if it appears as such in the commit record (for systems logging several identities related to the commit, authoring identity will be considered). Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: File stability index
desc: Average number of commits on files during the last month.

Average number of commits touching each file in source code management repositories dated during the last month. Source code management repositories are those considered as such in the project documentation. Commits in all branches are considered. A file is 'touched' by a commit if its content or its path are modified by the commit. Date used for each commit is 'author date' (when there is a difference between author date and committer date). Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: Median time to fix bug
desc: Median time between the creation of a bug report and its closure. Bugs are identified according to the registered type of issue.

Median period from when a ticket is open to when a ticket is closed, for all tickets closed during the last month, in the issue tracking system. The subset of tickets considered from the issue tracking system are those specified in the project documentation, for example by specifying a tracker or a project name appearing in ticket data. Closed means the state in which no further action is usually performed in the ticket. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included). Unit is days.

children.name: Number of open bugs
desc: Number of bugs in an open status at the time of analysis.

Number of tickets marked as still open at the time of the data retrieval, in the issue tracking system. The subset of tickets considered from the issue tracking system are those specified in the project documentation, for example by specifying a tracker or a project name appearing in ticket data. Open means the state in which further actions are usually expected until the ticket is closed.

children.name: Number of issues opened during last month
desc: Number of issues open during last month.

Number of tickets opened (new) during the last month, in the issue tracking system. The subset of tickets considered from the issue tracking system are those specified in the project documentation, for example by specifying a tracker or a project name appearing in ticket data. Opened means that the ticket information was submitted to the issue traking system for the first time for that ticket. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: Number of issue openers during last month
desc: Number of distinct openers of issues during last month.

Number of distinct identities opening tickets during the last month, in the issue tracking system. The subset of tickets considered from the issue tracking system are those specified in the project documentation, for example by specifying a tracker or a project name appearing in ticket data. Opened means that the ticket information was submitted to the issue traking system for the first time for that ticket. Identities of openers are the character strings found in the corresponding field in the ticket information. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: ITS updates
desc: Number of updates to the issue tracking system during last month.

Number of updates to tickets during the last month, in the issue tracking system. The subset of tickets considered from the issue tracking system are those specified in the project documentation, for example by specifying a tracker or a project name appearing in ticket data. Update means an operation on a ticket changing its state, or adding information. Opening and closing a ticket are considered as updates. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: ITS authors
desc: Number of different authors have contributed to the issue tracking system during last month.

Number of distinct identities updating tickets during the last month, in the issue tracking system. The subset of tickets considered from the issue tracking system are those specified in the project documentation, for example by specifying a tracker or a project name appearing in ticket data. Update means an operation on a ticket changing its state, or adding information. Opening and closing a ticket are considered as updates. Identities of updaters are the character strings found in the corresponding field in the ticket information. Last month is measured as one calendar month period starting the day before the data retrieval (example: if retrival is on Feb 3rd, period is from Jan 3rd to Feb 2nd, both included).

children.name: Defect density
desc: Overall total number of bugs on product divided by 1000's of lines (KLOC).

Ratio of the total number of tickets in the issue tracking system to the size of the source code in KLOC, at the time of the data retrieval. The subset of tickets considered from the issue tracking system are those specified in the project documentation, for example by specifying a tracker or a project name appearing in ticket data. Source code is all source code found in the source code management repository.

children.name: License identification
desc: Is there a list of the different licences used in the product?

children.name: IP log code coverage
desc: Total number of commits registered on the artefact during the last month.

children.name: Project is on time for next milestone
desc: Is the project on time for the next milestone?

children.name: Number of milestones
desc: The number of milestones since the last official release.

children.name: Milestone success rate
desc: What is the percentage of successful reviews over the past 10 releases?

children.name: SCM information
desc: Is the source_repo info correctly filled in the PMI? OLD: The number of documents published for the usage, access, and conventions of the software configuration management system.

children.name: ITS information
desc: Is the bugzilla info correctly filled in the PMI? OLD: The number of documents published for the usage, access, and conventions of the issue tracking system.

children.name: Installation survey
desc: A survey stating how much the software has been installed: number of users, geography (are the teams co-located or distributed?), etc.

children.name: Number of favourites on the Marketplace
desc: The number of favourites on the Eclipse Marketplace.

children.name: Number of successfull installs on the Marketplace
desc: The number of successful installs as reported on the http://marketplace.eclipse.org/content/eclipse-cdt-cc-development-tooling page, metrics tab.

children.name: Number of failed install on the Marketplace
desc: The number of failed installs as reported on the http://marketplace.eclipse.org/unsuccessful/installs/1373403/error_report.csv page, errors tab.

children.name: Number of downloads on update site
desc: The number of downloads on the update site of the project during last month. Is computed using successful and failed installs from marketplace.

children.name: Number of downloads on the web site
desc: The number of downloads on the web site of the project (download page) during last month. Example of download page (for CDT) : http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/ .

children.name: Number of publications
desc: The number of papers published in a recognised conference.
